result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony M Degeorge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall have no contact with Michael G. or Washington County Starbucks.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony M Degeorge

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

Def in person & by Atty William Andrew Mayer.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Resolution reached.  State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 2.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 and orders Ct. 2 dismissed and read in.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Cash bond to be applied to financial obligations.  Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.
Def in person & by Atty William Andrew Mayer.  Atty Mark David Bensen appeared for State.  Counsel is awaiting a doctor's report.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Def in person & by Atty William Andrew Mayer.  Atty Mark Bensen appeared for State.  Counsel's first appearance.  Adjourned to allow Defendant to begin counseling sessions.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
No contact with West Bend Starbucks
Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Def appeared in person.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  $250 cash bond continued.   Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #109021 on 8/16/15; COC Rec#15R 016901 dated 8/20/15
